citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A male Przewalski’s horse was noted to have widespread skin lesions, roughened haircoat, and signs of itching during
inspection. The Przewalski horse had hair loss on the muzzle, tail, legs and ears. He also had numerous lumps and dark
lesions on both sides of the torso. There was a small sore on the outside of the left foreleg. The animal was observed
vigorously rubbing his face and neck on a fence post twice within a 5–10-minute time frame. A female Przewalski horse
also in the pasture was in good condition. The facility had not noticed anything wrong with the male, and there had been
no evaluation of his condition by a veterinarian.
Failure to rapidly identify and treat health concerns can lead to unrelieved animal pain and suffering. Any health concerns
must be noted by the facility personnel and communicated in a timely manner to the attending veterinarian so that they
can examine animals and ensure that appropriate treatment is provided. This Przewalski horse must be evaluated by a
licensed veterinarian and treated appropriately.
Correct by 16 August 2024.
A complete routine inspection was conducted starting on 13 August 2024. This inspection report is limited to the Direct
non-compliance identified during this inspection. An additional inspection report will be delivered with the other issues
identified during this inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
MICHAEL TYGART, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
